formattedAddress: 110 W 40th St, New York, NY 10018, USA
adrFormatAddress: 110 W 40th St, New York, NY 10018, USA

editorialSummary.text: Laid-back restaurant dishing up gourmet hamburgers, tator tots and fries, plus craft beer.

originalText.text:
Decent place for a quick bite. Based on the reviews I had higher expectation for the burger. It was OK, but nothing to write home about. I think it could benefit from higher temp on the grill, to caramelise more/faster and stay more juice on the inside.
Rest of the burger were pleasant, but again, nothing outstanding.
I took their 6.6. I would recommend to try something more simple, perhaps it delivers better taste and value for money.

I liked their service. Self order, but lady explained how it works and gave quick recommendation. Followed up if everything was good.

text.text:

Rest of the burger were pleasant, but again, nothing outstanding.

originalText.text:
Such an incredible smash burger, definitely the best I’ve had in NYC. They also have a nice selection of craft beers which pairs really well with the burgers.

My husband got the burger of the month which was thanksgiving themed and it looked divine! I stuck to the regular OG burger and was not disappointed. I like how the patties are thin and crispy on the edges. We shared french fries and if you like garlic, you MUST get the garlic aioli! So so good.

I always respect when a burger place offers a variety of sauces, and this place definitely has a good selection.

Overall, my ONLY complaint is the metal chairs scraping on the concrete floor is a major headache inducer, so I wish those would just not exist; anywhere!

This place is awesome and if you’re looking for beer and delicious burgers, this is your spot!

originalText.text:
PROBABLY THE BEST BURGER I HAVE EVER HAD IN NYC!
I want to start off by saying the staff was so wonderful. They were very attentive and friendly. Greeted us with a smile and ready to help with any questions we had.

The burger and fries were so delicious. I believe this is the best burger I have ever had in NYC. It was so tasty, juicy, and fresh! My sister had the Spicy Chicken Sandwich and Tater Tots and they were both soooo good!

I'm so upset I'm just now discovering this place! But I will be back every time I'm in the city!

originalText.text:
Just a really great spot to grab a yummie, juicey burger.
Service is nice and well also the fries are great.
The bun is perfectly soft, the burger has a juicey and nice meaty taste.

text.text:
Just a really great spot to grab a yummie, juicey burger.
Service is nice and well also the fries are great.
The bun is perfectly soft, the burger has a juicey and nice meaty taste.

originalText.text: The place is really small but cozy. We wanted to eat at a table but the only thing available was at a bar they have overlooking the street. When there was a table available I asked one of the managers if I could change and she said no, that the person at that table was in the bathroom and it turns out that he had already left and the table was taken by some people who were just entering. We had to eat a little uncomfortable. The hostess gave all the best attention to a family that was at the table taking pictures of the food (maybe influencers), the meat is not sasonan with almost anything, the flavor is given by the other ingredients. And I found it expensive.  I particularly won't be back.
